title: Monkey has finger blown off after tourists feed it FIRECRACKERS disguised as food
text:
817 shares 157

A disturbing video showing a monkey being attacked with firecrackers by tourists has gone viral in China.
The distressing video shows, what seems to be, a macaque monkey eating some food and waiting for more, the People's Daily Online reported.
A group of men throw a bag of 'food' to the monkey, who, trusting the tourists, eagerly grabs it up.
Vile joke: A macaque monkey lost a finger after tourists played a cruel prank on it
Evil: Sadistic tourists threw firecrackers to a hungry macaque monkey begging for food. The footage is thought to have been filmed in Malaysia
Trust: The tourists betrayed the trust of the monkey, who eagerly grabbed the firecracker-filled package

Share this article Share It appears that he has just finished an almost identical looking bag of food, and, therefore, would not be suspicious of the new offering.
The package begins to smoke before exploding in the monkey's hands with a loud bang.
The monkey, naturally startled and hurt, runs off.
The cruel men who gave it the firecracker-filled package can be heard laughing.
Puzzled: The monkey is confused as the trick package begins to smoke, but doesn't not drop it
Agony: The package explodes in the monkey's hands with a large bang, taking off one of its fingers
The poor creature was gravely injured in the blast, which blew off one of its fingers on its left hand.
In pictures taken after the incident, the traumatised monkey can be seen cradling its wounded hand.
The monkey was later given emergency veterinary treatment.
PETA UK Associate Director Elisa Allen said: 'It is detestable that anyone would derive enjoyment from tormenting an animal who asked only for a morsel of food.'
The identity of the attackers, who filmed and posted the video anonymously, is unknown.
According to some news outlets, including Asian Town , the incident happened in Malaysia.
Traumatised: After the incident, the monkey appeared to be traumatised, cradling its wound
Hurt: The injured creature holds up its wounded hand, which is too graphic to be shown in full
Pain: The monkey looks at its injury forlornly, hunched over and scared
Suffering: The monkey lowers its head to its wound, which is obviously causing it a great deal of pain
